first_reasoning: Investing the full $10 million in the Industrial Products Division offers the fastest path back to profitability: sales momentum remains intact, clear process and product upgrade requests exist, and a milestone‐driven rollout with a 10 percent contingency will mitigate execution risk. This approach should deliver measurable margin gains within a few quarters, whereas a consumer breakthrough would likely take much longer to develop and scale.
second_reasoning: Allocating the entire pool to Industrial Products leverages its ongoing sales momentum and the field’s ready-to-implement process and product improvements. By structuring the 20 million in tranches tied to equipment upgrades, beta-run margin validation, and full rollout—while holding back 10 percent for contingencies—and deploying a cross-functional oversight team, we maximize our chance of driving margins positive and returning to profitability within a few quarters.
